comments.body: I tnink it would be most suited to cold biomes and Taiga biome. Light would keep it at bay and making a potion from a Wither Rose, Rotten Flesh and Milk and drinking the potion would summon it (because of the canniballistic nature of the myth). It would stand taller then any zombie being the size of a iron golem. Killing it has a rare chance of dropping the Wendigo helmet which would make the player not be attacked by zombies. In addition being attacked by the Wendigo not only depletes health but hunger as well. It would be a boss mob.
Can you describe what it looks like?

2 things. 1 the wendigo (in my mind) could most likely spawn at frostlands, now frostlands is kinda plain and theres not alot there. 2d the wendigo will not die from the sun and instead of it being a fake villager it could be a mob that follows other friendly mobs (yes even players) and will unleash roars letting other wendigos they see food they could be 5 or 4 blocks tall and stay in trees and jump really high

Granted media has probably skewed the Wendigo myth, but what about Wendigos protecting forestry? If players leave trees floating in midair (like the loading screen tells you not to do) the Wendigo will become hostile after a specific number of trees are left floating. Essentially the Wendigo prefers balance in nature and not overuse or misuse. Again, not sure how accurate this idea is against the true Wendigo myth.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&query=giant+squid

It appears there is already an existing thread on this topic (or something very similar). Feel free to join that discussion in progress. Cutting down on threads with very similar ideas will ideas to stay together so they can receive the attention they deserve from our developers. Even though you may not agree with all the exact ideas in the other thread(s), we love it when the community works together on ideas!

Thanks for your contribution.

Hi there, This feedback is incomplete and not really useable by our team in its current form. Can you explain more?

Constructive suggestions help us present requests to the team in a way that spells out what you may be looking for and generally focuses on three basic things:

  • WHAT you want done (we've got this, you'd like gekkos!)
  • WHY you want something done (missing)
  • HOW you want something done (how would they work? where do you find them?)

Hope that helps. Thanks for your contribution!

I think a gecko could  be something like a rabbit, a very small creature that isn‚Äôt super critical, but I also think it could be added to the desert, because it feels very bare there. It could vary in color patterns, from yellow to blue, and maybe you could have a rare gecko that (if your lucky) can drop a diamond when killed. Regular geckos could possibly drop gecko meat, And when cooked, can increase your hunger bar by +2, keeping in mind they are very small creatures. As i said, the desert feels a bit bare, so it might be a bit more lively with a little gecko friend :)
it should spawn in jungles

WHY geckos: For now only bees and axolotls are cute, one more animal wouldn't hurt. I think more pet animals would be really great, something like hamsters or geckos. Also it could open new "animal section" in minecraft - "pets you can take on a trip on your shoulder to the other part of the world..." or so :)

HOW geckos: For now only spiders can walk on walls, maybe geckos could also? Or even ceeling? Geckos could protect players from spiders ONLY? Could be found in jungle temples or new jungle structures. If we think of termites, it could also cooperate somehow, like protect wood or something.

If you eat gecko/gecko meat, you can like for 5 seconds walk on walls.

PS: I don't think geckos should drop diamonds, it's just silly. Maybe just exp or whole gecko for mixtures?

What do you want done?

Geckos, or an unidentified lizard species, to be added to Minecraft. These Geckos (or lizards) can be found in the desert, jungle, and underground/cave biome locations.

Why do you want something done?

Many players have commented before on a lack of desert mobs or a desire for more small cute (and harmless) mobs.

How do you want something done?

As previously mentioned, the lizard mob can spawn in at least three different biomes. Their colors can also reflect their environment (similar to parrots/birds and frogs). As for foods, I think there needs to be more insect type mobs added to Minecraft (as lizards eat insects or vegetables).
Nahhhhhh, that‚Äôs slightly useless and it‚Äôd make all the passive mobs dumb and annoying like scaredy-cat rabbits!

This is a very fun idea. I do believe we should have more of variety of animals, but honestly it when I look at the fox and the lack of interaction we can have with that animal, it does worry me that it won‚Äôt be as fun as it could be. One unique thing about the basic farm animals is that we were able to benefit from the animals. Including the cats and dogs it is a fun little touch that gives a sentimental value to a world. I believe when we added the fox we forgot about that to an extent. So yes I would love to have more animals but I would not just want to have animals to have animals I would want them to elevate my experience playing the game as well as others experiences

In Minecraft I always gravitate towards building villages for free-roaming NPC villagers. I just love the feeling of satisfaction of having my builds being ‚Äúuseful‚Äù and full of life. However, villagers can be really frustrating to deal with, so I‚Äôd love to see them get a little smarter as well. In my current world I have had to change the layout of my buildings to only occupy the first floor of every building because villagers couldn‚Äôt reliably find their beds on second or third floors. Even with that, I often see villagers standing two blocks away from their bed all night without moving because another villager‚Äôs bed is ‚Äúin the way‚Äù, though there are open paths around. I also see villagers standing at a window staring longingly in to the building where their work station is even though there‚Äôs a door just around the corner, and another door around the other corner for good measure. Just‚Ä¶ why. I don‚Äôt mind building with constraints for the sake of my silly villagers, but at a certain point it‚Äôs a hindrance on creativity in a game that‚Äôs all about being creative. Please if it is computationally possible consider making villagers just a little smarter. It would make this Minecrafter so very happy!

This comment about having to change buildings so villagers can find a bed or a workstation is so relatable, early today i got so mad i uninstalled the game. Villagers make me feel like my buildings aren't good enough, and it's obvious they're programmed this way, because other mobs like zombies and vindicators can go anywhere easily. So please, Mojang, make villagers at least find the door, right now they're frustrating and rage inducing.
The soul blazes should make similar sounds to what you hear when wandering the soul sand valley

i have a different idea. a soul blaze will fire off soul fire balls that will cause the normal damage from soul fire. however unlike the normal counterpart, it is more powerful and spawns much more rarely)it will spawn in the soul sand valley). it also attempts to keep itself in the soul sand valley due to the fact that it requires the souls it absorbs from the soul sand/soil to produce its flame. otherwise it will convert to a normal blaze.

I like your idea. I think both the feedback suggestions for a blue blaze and a soul blaze should be merged into one mob, so that it will create an amazing mob. Making it more difficult to kill makes sense because it would be more rewarding than a typical blaze. The idea of summoning undead mobs is a great idea!

In response to Kipy, it would be like a ghast, so not much lag.
The End is very stale, this would give it a mystical, dreamy feeling, I like it.

In response to KipyMudkip1. I understand that, but it shouldn't cause any more lag than any other mob in the game, and the sheer rarity of it would make any lag it did cause irrelevant. Not fitting in the game is unfortunately how many people feel about most updates (and how I initially felt about parrots and polar bears), but I think once something is inside the game, most of us love it :)

In response to Pwaaool. Yes I suppose it is like a ghast! I was comparing it to a phantom that you would want to find in the world, and the tracking it down with a compass idea I hope really adds to the mystical nature of it :)

Exactly, just since wolves and dogs are different colors ( most of the time ) and there are different dog breeds then that would be cool and also wolves bigger dogs a bit smaller. otherwise I absolutely love this idea!

Please change the name from "wolf" to "feral dog" or "stray dog".

Now that "wolves" are getting re-texturing, we need to push this idea more.

Wolves are NOT dogs. Wolves cannot be tamed. Calling the cute minecraft best friends "wolves" is spreading misinformation. In real life, people do try to keep wolves or wolf hybrids as pets. These animals are wild and there are numerous tragic incidents of fatalities, attacks, and animal cruelties.

Minecraft is about all education, right? They added bees to bring awareness to declining bee numbers. So why is Minecraft promoting the dangerous idea that you could keep a wolf as a pet?

I was just thinking about this myself. Historically, Geese were used as guards as well. So maybe if you tame a goose, it will honk loudly which can give specific activations for things like skulk, or tell villagers to go inside. It would honk any time it sees a hostile mob, which would also make it useful to bring into the mines to watch your back, and I'm sure redstoners would find an interesting use for that mechanic.
